title: Kevin Clifton Alex Scott apology leaked Strictly Come Dancing footage
text:
There were some spooky sounds coming from the #Strictly dancefloor on Saturday… 👀 It's time to listen in on Week Six! pic.twitter.com/8YZKTo2gED — BBC Strictly ✨ (@bbcstrictly) October 30, 2019

Strictly Come Dancing have revealed Kevin Clifton’s apology to Alex Scott as he replaced Neil Jones during Saturday night’s live show.

Neil was forced to pull out of the latest Strictly with an injury for Halloween Week, with last year’s champion Kevin stepping up after being booted out of the competition in the second bout with Anneka Rice.

However, with barely any rehearsal time, Kevin later admitted that he fluffed their contemporary routine before Neil went on to insist any mistakes made weren’t of his partner’s.

Kevin Clifton apologies to Alex Scott in leaked Strictly Come Dancing footage (Picture: BBC)

In their weekly roundup of the bets bits viewers couldn’t hear from the live show, Strictly revealed Kevin apologised to the former England international footballer.

‘Well done, you were amazing,’ he told Alex. ‘I’m so sorry.’

Thankfully, Neil has confirmed he’ll be back for an American Smooth with Alex this weekend.

Strictly fans watching from home tweeted in fuming that Gorka Marquez, who has been sat on the sub bench this series, wasn’t asked to fill in for Neil instead.

Neil Jones was forced to pull out of Strictly on Saturday night (Picture: BBC)

Strictly fans wanted to see Gorka on Saturday night (Picture: BBC)

‘Gorka is noticeably missing this series! @bbcstrictly you could of give Gorka the chance to stand in for Neil,’ tweeted one fan while another added: ‘If Neil’s having to have a replacement pro this week, why couldn’t it be Gorka or Graziano?’

‘Big mistake, Gorka should have been the stand-in for Neil,’ moaned another.

Even former professional James Jordan got in on the act, adding: ‘Shame they didn’t use Gorka to step in for Neil.’

Though, Gorka will be back on the dancefloor where he belongs for the upcoming Children In Need special where he’ll be performing with EastEnders star and former Strictly contender Louisa Lytton.

Strictly Come Dancing continues this Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.
